result.execSummary:
The defendant James Wallace McCoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber and/or electronic monitoring, if eligible.  

Jail to begin on or before 5 p.m. on March 29, 2016.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Judge Rosborough appears via phone (no objection by the parties).  Defendant James Wallace McCoy in court in Richland County with attorney Curtis Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper, in court in Richland County, appearing for State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend flee/elude to misdemeanor version 346.04(2t), a misdemeanor, for jt recommendation that includes dismissal of 15TR1323 and plea to 15TR1385.  Def pleads to count 1 as amended in 15CF71 and to the PAC citation 15TR1385.  Court's colloquy on plea 15CF71.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel address the Court.  Atty. Johnson states def is not asking for huber or EM (not employed at this time); also not asking for any credit.  Def addresses the Court.  

Sentence:
15TR1585 - $811.50, 6 mo revocation, AODA, no IID.
15CF71 - count 1 misdemeanor - 45 days in jail with huber in the event that def secures employment and/or EM if available.  Costs including DNA surcharge.  Jail to begin by 5 pm this evening.

60 days to pay fine in the TR case and costs in the criminal case.  Pay plan allowed - def to seek within 60 days.  

15TR1323 dismissed.

Atty. Johnson asks for affirmation from DA that paraphernalia charge will not be brought.  DA so affirms - State does not attend to bring that charge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

15TR1323, 15TR1385 & 15CF71 called together. Defendant James Wallace McCoy in court with attorney Curtis Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties request matter be setover for 30 days. JA is to contact Mr. Johnson and Ms. Harper re. scheduling on Friday.

Defendant James Wallace McCoy in court with attorney Curtis Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Rosborough appeared by phone from Vernon County.  15CF71, 15TR1323, and 15TR1385/status in all.  DA asks for prelim scheduling in the CF case.  Court sets Feb 17 at 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Wallace McCoy in court with attorney Curtis Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  AIA in 15CF71 and status in 15TR1323 and 15TR1385.  Court will recuse himself from these matters - knows def's parent.  Court completes the initial appearance in 15CF71.  Matters will be assigned to another judge prior to arraignment.  Counsel have indicated that def will be waiving the prelim.  That will happen once the new judge is on board.

Next status in TR cases will be set by the new judge, together with 15CF71 which will be set for adjourned initial as the prelim has not yet been held or waived.

Defendant James Wallace McCoy in court with attorney Curtis Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defense has received a copy of the complaint, waives formal reading of complaint as well as time limits for preliminary hearing. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Court accepts waiver of time periods for prelim. Status requested and set. Defense requests traffic matters be reset also.
